results.title: For all practical purposes. Computer science. 4
results.creator_credit: Lance Wisniewski, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description: Creating codes Developing the concept of binary codes, introduced in the previous episode, this program looks at some of the different codes which can be devised, including ASCII which is a 7 bit code, the Laplacian pyramid which is used for encoding pictorial images and the Hamming code, which enables computers to overcome random errors.

results.title: Footy chicks
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Barry, Michaela Perske, Australian Film Commission, Red Ithaka Productions and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Many Australians love their football; many Australian women also desire the men who play it. Michaela Perske and Rebecca Barry have made a hard-hitting documentary that uses a combination of interviews, observational filming and stylised re-enactments to examine some of the interactions between football players and “Footy Chicks”. In the early 21st century, Australia saw a number of allegations of sexual assaults on women made against football players and clubs from both the Rugby League and AFL codes. Against this background, “Footy Chicks” explores the gender and sexual power relationships, and the attitudes of both players and women to the fun and the dangers involved in the sexual culture of Australian football. As well as the players and “footy chicks” who speak for themselves, interviewees include Kath Haines from Footy Fans Against Sexual Assault; Dr Clifton Evers, Lecturer in Gender Studies; Dr Catharine Lumby, Associate Professor Media Studies, and Karen Willis from the New South Wales Rape Crisis Centre.

results.title: Food Victoria: a whole world of food (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Food Victoria, Multimedia Victoria and Victorian Dairy Industry Authority
results.brief_description: Victoria produces a third of Australia’s raw and processed food. The multimedia interactive program is divided into four sections: Victoria, Dairy, Stone Fruit and a Directory based on a supermarket interface. A wealth of information with excellent graphics and video presentations.

results.title: Food
results.creator_credit: G Gokhale and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film, without commentary, produced by a guest filmmaker from India, Gopal K. Gokhale, during a period of workstudy at the National Film Board. The film is intended to demonstrate to farm audiences in developing countries how improved farming practices and technology increase crop yield and income. Film without words.

results.title: Fonteyn and Nureyev: The perfect partnership
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Robert Powell, this is the remarkable story of the unique dancing collaboration of Margot Fonteyn and Rudolph Nureyev that brought joy to millions around the world. Thought by many to be the most sensational partnership ever, it is certainly one against which all others will be judged. Theirs was a collaboration of two very contrasting personalities. Fonteyn, an experienced ballerina, idolized already for her own achievements and for whom stardom seemed an effortless progression. Nureyev, half her age and relatively unknown, had to thrust his way into a dancing career against the advice of family and friends. This wonderful voyage through their careers together is filled with the opinions and reminisces of the friends and contemporaries and some rare and intimate footage of the perfect partners. It includes performances from the ballets; Romeo and Juliet, Le Corsaire, Giselle, Swan Lake, Marguerite and Armand, Les Sylphides, Birthday Offering, Hamlet Prelude and Lucifer.

results.title: Fong Sai Yuk = The Legend
results.creator_credit: Yuen Kwai and Eastern Production Company
results.brief_description: In order to win favour with the villagers, local official Tiger Lei proposes a kung-fu championship with his beautiful daughter, Ting Ting’s hand in marriage as the prize. His wife, a champion martial arts practitioner will provide the competition, and the footage of the fight sequences played out on scaffolding is truly amazing. Unbeknownst to her father, Ting Ting has fallen in love with Fong Sai Yuk (Jet Li), who defended her honour, won her heart, and earned the wrath of those he defeated in protecting her. Sai Yuk enters the contest, unaware he is duelling to win the girl he loves, and throws the fight when he mistakenly identifies a family servant as the intended bride. Sai Yuk’s mother, mortified at her son’s defeat, skilled in martial arts and willing to challenge the mores of society enters the competition disguised as Sai Yuk’s brother, wins the contest, as well as the adoration of the woman she defeated. The film culminates in an all out action sequence where identities are revealed, loyalties challenged and amazing skills are displayed. Cast also includes Josephine Siao, Michele Reis and Hu Hui Chang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Folk song fantasy
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated puppets and paper cut-outs enact the narratives contained in three folk songs sung by Emma Caslor: “THE RIDDLE SONG”, “WHO KILLED COCK ROBIN ?”, and “THE COOPER OF FIFE”. Animation by Alma Duncan; photography by Lyle Enright.

results.title: Recycled reflections
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film which first emphasises the potentially great waste in the single product, automobile bumpers, by exploring the piles of twisted discards. It then follows the process of transforming the damaged bumpers into good-as-new ones. Shows the recycling process from the heavy machines used to straighten the major dents and twists through hand-hammering, grinding, polishing and electro-plating. Finally, the transformed bumpers, indistinguishable from newly made ones, are plastic wrapped and stored awaiting use on new cars.

results.title: Folk art: the Diana Brandt way
results.brief_description: Nationally renowned folk artist Diana Brandt brings her expertise, handy hints and experience to help you create traditional Bavarian Folk Art for your home. The equipment needed to complete two projects is shown and explained. The three strokes that comprise folk art are demonstrated clearly, simply and step-by-step so that you may practice to perfection at your own pace in your home. Includes scores of hints and shortcuts. Project One is a beautiful oval storage box with a delightfully rustic antique flower arrangement painted on the cover. Project Two is a teapot stand with a simple baroque design.

results.title: Follow you follow me
results.brief_description: Examines the complexities in the friendship of two teenage boys - one a shy thirteen year old whose father owns a factory, and the other a confident extrovert whose father is an employee and shop steward at this same factory. An industrial dispute directly affects this friendship and the intensity of their feelings is revealed.
